channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A new IKEA location received a record-breaking 3,730 applications for just 150 open roles. Inside the pay and perks luring talent back to retail
item.description: IKEA’s new location in London offers employees livable wages, flexible schedules, and other perks.

item.title: U.S. stocks end higher as investors brush off Trump’s tariffs on steel, aluminum
Hawaii court blocks insurers’ claims, salvaging $4 billion Maui wildfire settlement
item.description: Insurance companies insisted that they should have the right to go after the defendants separately to recoup money paid out to policyholders.

item.title: BYD expands ‘God’s Eye’ intelligent driving into its entry level cars, sending other China EV shares tumbling
item.description: Shares of competitors Li Auto, Xpeng, and Geely Auto fell by 6%, 9% and 10% respectively.

item.title: Buy Nvidia’s stock ahead of earnings? This analyst makes the case.
Why Apple may get the ‘last laugh’ in AI as rivals double down on spending craze
Trump blasts WFH policies: ‘Nobody is gonna work from home. They are gonna be going out, playing tennis, playing golf’
item.description: President Donald Trump claims federal employees working from home are playing golf, working 10% of the time and taking on second jobs.

item.title: EU to mobilize $206 billion in AI investment. ‘The AI race is far from over’ says chief
item.description: At the Paris AI summit, the European Commission president said the EU would contribute 50 billion euros with the rest pledged by "providers, investors...

item.title: Trump's reciprocal tariffs may make imports from these countries more expensive
Sam Altman brushes off Musk's bid for OpenAI control as rocky saga escalates
